_header: Weenest thou that thou dost not wickedly
Subjects: advice, moral; wealth, wise use of
_description: Moral advice for a rich man to give to the poor to save his soul — four stanzas rhyme royal

PhilRos108330.Transcription:
Wenyst thou that thou doost nat wykkydlyThat so many a mannys
                    sustinaunceWors is no thyng than to love moneyAs that Ecclesiasticus
                    weel can sey
PhilRos108330.Note:
Follows explicit to De Regimine Principum (3581; by same hand as
                    envoy.
